intro: Xiphopteris subpinnatifida, commonly known as the slender chain fern, is a member of the Polypodiaceae family. It is a terrestrial fern characterized by its delicate, strap-like fronds that are typically 30–60 cm in length. The plant has a short, creeping rhizome and produces small, pale green to brown spore-bearing structures called sori on the underside of its leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky crevices. Xiphopteris subpinnatifida is often found in temperate to subtropical regions and is valued for its ornamental appearance in horticulture.
